4. Five-year Accident History
The Electrolux Anderson Facility has had no RMP incidents in the past five years.  There are no incidents to report.  Should a release occur it shall be documented in section III of this submittal.

5. Emergency Response Plan
Our facility has a written emergency response plan to respond to accidental releases of hazardous
materials. The plan addresses aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and
medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public.
The plan is updated to reflect pertinent changes taking place within our processes that may require a modified emergency response. Emergency responders are trained or drilled on an annual basis.
Anderson County Department of Emergency Services is the Local Emergency Planning
Committee (LEPC) with which our emergency plan has been coordinated and verified.

Electrolux - Anderson, South Carolina Facility

1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies
Our facility is strongly committed to employee, public, and environmental safety. This commitment is
demonstrated by our comprehensive accidental release prevention program that covers areas such
as design, installation, operating procedures, maintenance, and employee training associated with
the processes at our facility. It is our policy to implement appropriate controls to prevent possible
releases of regulated substances and to protect people, property, and the environment.  The required elements of RMP Level 1 that have been implemented include:

1.	Worse Case Release Analysis
2.	5 year accident history tracking and Incident Investigation
3.	Anderson Campus Emergency Action Plan (Currently Rev.04)
4.	Coordination with local responders (Outlined in site Emergency Action Plan)

In addition to the required RMP elements, the Anderson site has prevention measures in place consistent with OSHA PSM 29 CFR 1910.119.

2. The Stationary Source and the Regulated Substances Handled
Our facility's primary activities encompass the manufacturing of refrigeration units.  We have one regulated substance above the RMP threshold quantity present at our facility. There are no regulated toxic substances on-site. The regulated flammable substance is Isobutane.  Isobutane is received and stored in its pure state, and it is used as a refrigerant in the cooling system of each refrigeration unit. The maximum quantity of Isobutane stored on-site is 12,600 gallons (59,220 lbs).

3. The General Accidental Release Prevention Program and the Chemical-Specific Prevention Steps

requirements set out under 40 CFR part 68 of the EPA. The following sections briefly describe the
elements of the accidental release prevention and process safety managements programs that are
